data.title: Implement building conditions for Sounds (Speech etc)
data.body:
It would be nice to implement Prereqs for sounds, for example:
- "Missle launch detected" should only be played when we have a radar which give us the ability to detect a Missle launch.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7323263-implement-building-conditions-for-sounds-speech-etc?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Cleaned up the ingame widget initialization
data.body: This makes integrating the ingame map editor https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 easier, but is also a nice cleanup in itself.

data.title: Use travis_retry to reduce the nuget timeout errors.
data.body: As suggested by http://blog.travis-ci.com/2013-05-20-network-timeouts-build-retries/

data.title: Make production type hotkeys configurable.
data.body: Fixes #7198.

data.title: A campaign progression system
data.body: It doesn't have to be too fancy (initially), it would be enough if a yaml file told the game what mission to start / what selection screen to display next, depending on the information stored in the after-mission savegames proposed in  #7213.

data.title: Implement singleplayer savegames (after mission has been accomplished)
data.body:
Basically, an option to make a mission drop a simple savegame that (at least initially) just contains a minimum of useful informations (metadata).

Information that the file should contain:
- Short name/ID of the accomplished mission (example: allies01).
- Which primary and secondary objectives have been accomplished or failed (could be extremely useful for non-linear campaigns, for example if two secondary objectives exclude each other. What mission comes next then depends on which secondary objective you chose to complete).

Optional (but presumably very easy):
- How much cash did the player have at the end of the mission (TD/RA had a CarryOver feature that could give you a small percentage of the previous missions' end-cash as a bonus at the start of the next mission).

Note: This should also be much easier to implement than in-game savegames and would allow us to finally implement a campaign system.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7317637-implement-singleplayer-savegames-after-mission-has-been-accomplished?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Revert to stable SharpFont version 2.5.0.1
data.body: Fixes #7202.

data.title: Added two additional community maps to the Dune 2000 mod
data.body: See https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7124

data.title: [Editor] Check for valid map size
data.body:
fixes: #7207
fixes: #7208

This Pr is a try to prevent crashes when Map creators, using invalid Map Sizes (Size & Bounds) ...
it will be good to know which map sizes are allowed and which is the smallest allowed Map!

data.title: AI difficulty on all currently available 3 games plus some tweaks.
data.body:
We've had some lanparties and for the sake of nostalgia, we just look to play some 4vsX computer-stomping (or getting stomped by them) >:)

  Anyway, i think the hardest AI definitely should receive a tune-up, its cool to try to "crack-a-turtle-shell" when playing vs AI, defending endless waves of brutal attacks and trying to advance from that hard situation into offensive mode. As some previous posts mentioned, harvesters could be limited (or maybe you're dealing with the pathfinding problem instead) or harvesters could bring in some extra cash for hardest AI to compensate and to keep them sharp all the time, instead of building extremely excessive amounts of harvesters. C&C3 Brutal Steamrollers was the real cool AI to play agains, for example! =) This would probably need one extra difficulty level for current three settings.

This might not be the highest priority for now, but these tune-up / tweaking issues would be definitely great for ppl like me or some friends of mine, who doesnt really enjoy doing Player vs Player, but just vs AI for fun and talking stuff on voicecomm or lanparty!

 Thanks for contributing and making this game, it makes our nostalgia-gaming possible :) I wish i had the skill to contribute and help, but no can do, will have to take the bastard-role of just suggesting stuff!

data.title: CCleaner - "winapp2.com enhancer" can delete OpenRA Logs & Replays!
data.body:
Recently Updates to the winapp2.com - ccleaner addition can now cleanup OpenRA support files, we should inform the user / Players to pay attention when they cleanup the System!

```
[OpenRA*]
Section=Games
DetectFile=%Documents%\OpenRA\Logs
Default=False
FileKey1=%Documents%\OpenRA\Logs|*.*
```

data.title: Make fetch-thirdparty-deps.ps1 work on more Windows platforms.
data.body: Works around a problem some people were having with Invoke-WebRequest not being available on their system because of an old version of PowerShell.

data.title: Added the Tiberian Sun harvest animation
data.body: as discussed in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7194#discussion_r22291607 and IRC.

data.title: Avoid initialization of graphical elements for a server.
data.body: Avoid allocating memory and resources for graphical elements that will never be drawn when starting a dedicated server. This reduces the server memory footprint by approx 17 MiB.

data.title: Potential issue with latest freetype6.dll
data.body: The latest freetype6.dll fetched via nuget crashes OpenRA.Game for me. using an older dll from September fixes this crash.

data.title: Split TD weapons.yaml into multiple categorised yamls
data.body:
Only CnC mod for now.
This is far from finished, I'd like to get some feedback and ideas before I continue working on this (and especially before I apply this yaml/folder structure to other mods).

data.title: Load dynamically map
data.body:
I was trying to create a dedicated OpenRA server on my Raspberry Pi so I downloaded a release and rsync map from resources. When I connected on the server on my Raspberry Pi, it crashed because it runned out of RAM while loading the maps.

I think this shouldn't happen, maps should be loaded when it is needed. They should not use more that 400 mb of RAM...

Maybe using a B-Tree could fix this.

data.title: Soviets don't have any hero units
data.body:
There's no Soviet counterpart for Tanya in OpenRA. 
The original Red Alert had Tanya for both factions. In Counterstrike (or Aftermath?), Westwood introduced Volkov and Chitzkoi... they could be a nice addition.

data.title: Non-redefinable keys for production tabs; T conflicting
data.body: Keys for production tabs (E - buildings, R - defenses, T - infantry etc.) can't be redefined in settings. Also, the T key is set to select units of given type by default. So, instead of selecting all riflemen (for example), the UI opens the infantry tab...

data.title: Cleaned most of the thirdparty folder from foreign binaries
data.body:
A followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7190 that fetches all I could find from www.nuget.org.

As a side-effect it updates Mono.Nat with an improved version from https://github.com/nterry/Mono.Nat and it also updates SharpFont as well as NUnit 2 to the latest version.

data.title: Added the intro videos to the first missions as background info
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7072.

data.title: Red Alert is lagy
data.body: So im experiencing problems in fps with ra while not with the other games on my geforce fx 5500

data.title: More Mods.RA reorganisation, more files moved to Mods.Common
Fix and enforce code style in Mods.Common, D2k, and TS.
Refactoring Logging logic
data.body:
This Pr changes the Logic of the logging to Channels, instead of static strings ("server") which defines the Channels, which causes often causes crashes with "Logging to not existing Channel", we will now have fixed Definitions. ("Server")

This will give us the following:
- Fixed Channel name Style (we cannot misstype a channel: "Server" instead of "server")
- AddChannel needs only one argument instead of two
- We can see a full list of Channel which are Available :)

This is requiering the following:
- All FileName are not fully Lowercase ("Server" instead of "server")

data.title: Added the Nod missile silo and the Ion Cannon to the Tiberian Sun mod
data.body: This adds http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Missile_Silo_(Tiberian_Sun) and http://cnc.wikia.com/wiki/Multi_missile

data.title: Added yaml and code style analysis commands to OpenRA.Utility
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7145 with `chmod +x` included,`.gitignore` adaptions and CI integration.

data.title: Refactoring the logging logic
data.body:
- Define Logging Channels
- Get Rid of Counted Filenames
- Make Channel Creation easier :)
